TITLE: China home sales drop in July, exposing fragile market
SUMMARY: China's housing market made some gains in May and June, but July's substantial drop has largely blunted any gains made by the previous months of recovery.

TITLE: Ukrainian agriculture tycoon killed by Russian shelling, Zelenskyy says
SUMMARY: Ukrainian agriculture tycoon Oleksiy Vadaturskyi and his wife were killed by Russian shelling in the city of Mykolaiv, Ukrainian officials said on Sunday.

TITLE: NATO says it's prepared to intervene in Kosovo if ‘stability is jeopardized’
SUMMARY: NATO issued a statement Sunday saying its Kosovo Force Pristina (KFOR) was prepared to intervene if tensions at the border with Serbia threatened stability.

TITLE: First grain shipment leaves Ukraine after months of Russian blockade amid food crisis
SUMMARY: Over 26,000 tons of Ukrainian corn is on its way to Lebanon after the first ship set off from Odesa Monday following an agreement between Ukraine, Russia, Turkey and the U.N.

TITLE: For China's military planners, Taiwan is not an easy island to invade
SUMMARY: An invasion of Taiwan could be costly for China despite a military imbalance, given the island's geographic features and decades of defensive preparations.

TITLE: Shooting behind restaurant in Canada leaves 6 people wounded
SUMMARY: Six shooting victims were identified after gunshots were fired behind a restaurant early Monday in the town of Ajax in southern Ontario, according to authorities in Canada.

TITLE: Australian Senator Lidia Thorpe calls Queen Elizabeth II a ‘colonizing’ leader during swearing-in ceremony
SUMMARY: Lidia Thorpe of the Australian Greens party was heard calling Queen Elizabeth II a colonizer Monday during her swearing-in ceremony at the Parliament House in Canberra.

TITLE: Student Builds Platform to Help World Stay Informed About Ukraine War
SUMMARY: 21-year-old student Bernard Moerdler developed a platform called Ukraine Sirens Alert which alerts the citizens of Ukraine from incoming Russian missile attacks.

TITLE: Chinese military posts video boasting military might ahead of Pelosi trip to Taiwan
SUMMARY: The Chinese military increased its hostile rhetoric ahead of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's potential visit to Taiwan, posting a video showing troops conducting war drills.

TITLE: Mexican President Lopez Obrador sparks concerns after tough statements on US energy dispute
SUMMARY: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has raised concerns after issuing a tough statement on a US-led complaint over Obrador increasing state control over energy.

TITLE: Who is Ayman Al Zawahiri? Al Qaeda leader killed in Afghanistan
SUMMARY: Ayman Al Zawahiri was a top deputy to Al Qaeda leader Usama bin Laden before taking the helm of the organization after his predecessor’s death in 2011.

TITLE: Iran declares it can use nuclear missiles to turn 'New York into hellish ruins'
SUMMARY: While President Biden fails to use pressure to stop Iran's atomic weapons program, Iran is on the brink of setting a nuclear weapon in motion and threatening to target NYC.

TITLE: US sending $550 million in military aid to Ukraine, including HIMARS ammunition
SUMMARY: The United States is sending another $550 in military aid, including ammunition for High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems, to Ukraine, officials announced.

TITLE: Iran gains foothold in South America as Biden admin pursues nuclear deal
SUMMARY: Iran has gained a foothold in South America, undermining U.S. interests in the region as the Biden administration attempts to rekindle the Obama-era nuclear deal.

TITLE: Next al-Qaeda leader will be more brutal to attract next generation of terrorists, 'Drone Warrior' author says
SUMMARY: "Drone Warrior" Brett Velicovich believes Ayman al-Zawahri's replacement as the leader of al Qaeda could be more brutal to attract the younger terrorists.

TITLE: Pelosi touches down in Malaysia amid tensions over trip to Taiwan
SUMMARY: Amid tensions with China over an expected trip to Taiwan, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi met with Malaysian officials in Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday.

TITLE: Taiwan sees cyber-attack, Chinese warplanes amid spat with China over expected Pelosi visit
SUMMARY: Taiwan on Tuesday was hit with a cyber-attack and threatened by Chinese war planes flying near its unofficial boundary in the Taiwan Strait ahead of a speculated visit from House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.

TITLE: Pelosi's visit to Taiwan has locals supportive but increasingly concerned over China threats
SUMMARY: Locals tell Fox News Digital that the reality of Speaker Pelosi's visit is kicking in as Beijing raises its rhetoric over her visit.

TITLE: Putin spokesman accuses US of 'provoking' China amid expected Pelosi trip to Taiwan
SUMMARY: Spokesman to Russian President Vladimir Putin, Dmitry Peskov, accused the U.S. of 'provoking' China amid speculation that Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi could visit Taiwan.

TITLE: Russian official sets sights on Georgia occupation after 'liberation of Kyiv' in allegedly hacked post
SUMMARY: Top Russian security official Dmitry Medvedev calls for the occupation of Georgia following the 'liberation of Kyiv' in allegedly 'hacked' post.

TITLE: Pelosi Taiwan trip: 4 US warships positioned east of island
SUMMARY: A Pentagon spokesperson confirmed to Fox News that the USS Ronald Reagan is currently operating in the Phillipine Sea near Taiwan in what the military said is standard drills.

TITLE: Taiwan sees cyberattack, Chinese warplanes amid spat with China over expected Pelosi visit
SUMMARY: Taiwan on Tuesday was hit with a cyber-attack and threatened by Chinese war planes flying near its unofficial boundary in the Taiwan Strait ahead of a speculated visit from House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.

TITLE: UK police say British Army veteran arrested because anti-LGBTQ social media post 'caused anxiety': video
SUMMARY: A police officer in the United Kingdom was seen on video lecturing a handcuffed British veteran that his social media meme of the Pride flag in the shape of a swastika "caused anxiety."

TITLE: China furious after Pelosi lands in Taiwan, promises 'all necessary measures' to defend itself
SUMMARY: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs for the People's Republic of China released a lengthy statement Tuesday after House Speaker Nancy Pelosi landed in Taiwan.

TITLE: Taiwan thanks Pelosi for 'support' during controversial visit, saying island is 'not alone'
SUMMARY: The Taiwanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs thanked House Speaker Nancy Pelosi for following through on her planned trip to Taiwan despite harsh warnings from China.

TITLE: A 5.3 magnitude earthquake rocks Honduras, no casualties reported
SUMMARY: A 5.3 magnitude earthquake occurred in northern Honduras on Tuesday morning but did not cause significant damage or claim any victims.

TITLE: United States includes Putin's rumored girlfriend in latest round of sanctions
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin's reported girlfriend, Alina Maratovna Kabaeva, was included in the latest round of sanctions announced Tuesday by the US.

TITLE: State Department approves potential sale of 300 Patriot missiles to Saudi Arabia
SUMMARY: A $3.05 billion sale of 300 Patriot missiles was approved by the State Department for Saudi Arabia on Tuesday, the Defense Security Cooperation Agency said.

TITLE: UK man caught at Windsor Castle with crossbow charged for allegedly intending to 'injure or alarm' the Queen
SUMMARY: The Crown Prosecution Service announced that a man who was arrested with a crossbow at Windsor Castle last year will face charges under the 1842 Treason Act.

TITLE: Wife of Navy lieutenant imprisoned in Japan reveals young child's response
SUMMARY: The spouse of Navy Lt. Ridge Alkonis said his sentence to three years in a Japanese president has been hard, most notably for their children who are without their father.

TITLE: Pelosi defies China during meeting with Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen: 'We will not abandon our commitment'
SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan included a meeting with Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen, where the American lawmaker reaffirmed the U.S. commitment to supporting Taiwan.

TITLE: Ukraine takes out Russian ammunition railway connecting Kherson to Crimea
SUMMARY: Ukrainian forces have taken out a Russian ammunitions railway connecting Kherson to the Crimean Peninsula, further blocking logistical supply lines relied on by Russian troops.

TITLE: Pelosi Taiwan trip: Iran, Syria join list of countries condemning controversial visit
SUMMARY: Syria and Iran join chorus of Chinese allies condemning US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's delegation to Taiwan with statements reiterating the One China Policy.

TITLE: US seeks to seize mysterious plane grounded in Argentina and linked to Iran
SUMMARY: The U.S. is seeking to seize a Venezuelan plane linked to a U.S.-sanctioned Iranian airline that has alleged ties to terrorist organizations after it landed in Argentina.

TITLE: Mystery Chile sinkhole opens up near underground mine
SUMMARY: A mysterious sinkhole that officials say is 105 feet wide and 210 feet deep has opened up near the site of an underground mining operation in northern Chile.

TITLE: Zelenskyy says Russia should be declared a terrorist state following mass killing of 50 POWs
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has called on the international community to deem Russia a 'terrorist state' following the attack on Ukrainian POWs in Olenivka.

TITLE: China launches live-fire military drills around Taiwan in fury after Pelosi visit
SUMMARY: The People's Liberation Army of China is holding live-fire drills near Taiwan in the aftermath of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's historic visit to the disputed island.

TITLE: First grain ship to leave Ukraine passes inspection, world waits for more
SUMMARY: The first grain ship to leave Ukraine passes inspection carrying 26,000 metric tons of corn headed for Lebanon.

TITLE: Taiwanese protestors reject Pelosi, shout: 'Get out of here, Pelosi. We don't need you'
SUMMARY: Protestors in Taiwan were not happy when U.S. Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi arrived in Taipei, leading chants and holding signs calling Pelosi a "warmonger."

TITLE: Seven men, 4 women face charges for alleged Glasgow child sex ring involving 'witchcraft'
SUMMARY: 11 people in Glasgow, Scotland, are accused of running a child sex ring involving demonic rituals, "seances," and "witchcraft" for a period spanning just over a decade.

TITLE: Italy ratifies NATO membership for Finland, Sweden
SUMMARY: Italy's parliament gave its final approval ratifying Finland and Sweden in the NATO alliance. The Senate voted by a majority of 202 to 13 in favor of the bill.

TITLE: All Taiwanese public institutions targeted by cyberattacks just hours before Pelosi visit
SUMMARY: All public institutions in Taiwan were targeted by cyberattacks this Tuesday, just hours before the US Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi landed in the island nation.

TITLE: Iceland volcano near major airport erupts second time in a year
SUMMARY: A volcano erupted Wednesday in Iceland near the capital city of Reykjavík. Authorities said that the eruption did not disrupt the nearby airport.

TITLE: Zelenskyy adviser says Russia must pull troops out of Ukraine before dialogue can take place
SUMMARY: An adviser to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Wednesday that any constructive dialogue would require a "cease-fire and troops withdrawal."

SUMMARY: U.S. intelligence officials believe Russia is seeking to plant evidence at the site of a prison attack, that left at least 53 people dead, in an effort to blame Ukraine.

SUMMARY: Chinese military command announced the successful execution of exercises in the Taiwan Strait, including "precision missile strikes," following House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit.

TITLE: Russia rains 60 rounds of shells in southern Ukraine as it ramps up offensive along Dnieper River
SUMMARY: Ukraine's southern regions hit hard by Russian shelling after Ukrainian forces begin to make some strategic advances along the Dnieper River.

TITLE: Russia and China grow closer following Pelosi’s Taiwan visit
SUMMARY: Experts argue House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's controversial trip to Taiwan has maintained America's top spot as the leading world power, despite criticism it could risk military collision.

TITLE: Blinken visit to Southeast Asia highlights importance of potential battleground with China
SUMMARY: Several nations have explored the possibility of investing in Southeast Asia due to China's COVID-19 policies and growing concerns over a Taiwan invasion.

TITLE: Brittney Griner, Paul Whelan trade needs to 'get over the line,' even at cost of 'Merchant of Death': experts
SUMMARY: Former State Department official Joel Rubin criticized Putin for using Brittney Griner as a tool to "embarrass" the United States and urged officials to complete the swap.

TITLE: Explosion at German WWII ammunition dump starts blaze near Berlin
SUMMARY: German firefighters are combating an uncontrolled blaze near Berlin after World War II ammunition detonated at a police facility in Grunewald forest on Thursday.

TITLE: Marc Fogel: Congressmembers ask Blinken to add Pennsylvania native to potential Griner, Whelan prisoner swap
SUMMARY: Several members of U.S. Congress have signed a letter to Secretary of State Anthony Blinken asking that Marc Fogel be included in the potential prisoner exchange with Russia.

TITLE: Official: Ex Puerto Rico Governor Wanda Vazquez arrested
SUMMARY: Puerto Rico's former governor Wanda Vázquez was arrested Thursday on corruption charges, along with two other unidentified individuals.

TITLE: Marc Fogel: Congress members ask Blinken to add Pennsylvania native to potential Griner, Whelan prisoner swap
SUMMARY: Several members of U.S. Congress have signed a letter to Secretary of State Antony Blinken asking that Marc Fogel be included in the potential prisoner exchange with Russia.

TITLE: Spanish coast guard rescues French sailor trapped for 16 hours in capsized boat
SUMMARY: A French sailor survived for 16 hours inside an air bubble of his capsized sailboat adrift in the Atlantic Ocean before Spanish coast guard rescuers saved him.

TITLE: Chinese ballistic missiles land inside Japan's exclusive economic zone for first time
SUMMARY: Five missiles filed by China landed in Japanese-controlled water, Japan's Ministry of Defense said Thursday, after House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit.

TITLE: Health crisis in Ukraine worsens as medical facilities still under attack
SUMMARY: As the conflict between Russia and Ukraine rages on, the Health crisis in Ukraine is getting worse and worse, especially as Russia continues to attack medical facilities.

TITLE: Zelenskyy advisor says Ukraine will hold peace talks when it has military might to repel Russia
SUMMARY: A top advisor to President Zelenskyy said Kyiv will engage in peace talks with Moscow once Ukraine has the military capabilities to repel Russian forces from its lands.

SUMMARY: South Korean airlines canceled flights to Taiwan through Friday. China is conducting aggressive military exercises around the island as the US urges them not to overreact.

TITLE: Senators, experts urge Biden to deny visa to Iran's president ahead of UN General Assembly
SUMMARY: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi did not attend last year's General Assembly, and he has remained a difficult figure during negotiations on a nuclear deal.

TITLE: Belarus checks combat readiness on border, Ukraine secures Kyiv defenses
SUMMARY: Belarus is testing combat readiness of special operations forces as its troops along border bolster their defenses.

TITLE: Iranian officials openly discuss country's ability to make nuclear weapon
SUMMARY: Some officials have maintained that the country's Supreme Leader Khamenei has no interest in producing a nuclear weapon, despite the ability to make weapons-grade material.

TITLE: Taliban claims it was unaware al-Qaeda chief al-Zawahri was in Afghanistan before US drone strike
SUMMARY: The Taliban on Thursday claimed to have no prior knowledge that al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahri was staying in Kabul before U.S. drone strike.

TITLE: Afghan Sikhs seek refuge in India due to religious persecution at home
SUMMARY: Sikhs living in Afghanistan are fleeing their home country for India to escape religious persecution, a long-standing issue for all religious minorities in the nation.

TITLE: Report: Ukrainian forces hunkering down in communities endanger civilians
SUMMARY: Ukrainian forces may have exposed vulnerable civilians to Russian attacks by basing themselves in residential buildings, such as schools, in highly populated areas.

TITLE: Gaza faces possible blackout as Israeli blockade continues for third day
SUMMARY: The Gaza Strip faces a possible blackout as Israeli blockade enters third day. The sole power plant for Gaza will have to be shut down if the blockade persists for 48 more hours.

TITLE: United States delays long-planned ICBM test amid tensions with China
SUMMARY: The Biden administration announced a delay to a long-planned intercontinental ballistic missile test on Thursday amid escalating tensions with China.

TITLE: Ukrainian ports gradually opening up as three more ships loaded with food set to depart
SUMMARY: Ships carrying a combined total of 58,000 tons of corn are set to depart Ukrainian ports on Friday under a deal brokered by the United Nations and Turkey.

TITLE: North Korea preparing for atomic tests, dodges sanctions in drive for weapons
SUMMARY: A leaked draft of a U.N. report on North Korea's 2022 activities details the ways in which Kim Jong Un's regime is able to dodge sanctions and continue pursuing its nuclear weapon ambitions.

TITLE: South Korean president skips in-person meeting with Pelosi, causing controversy
SUMMARY: Speaker Pelosi's visit to South Korea has sparked controversy among Korean public. Many are critical President Yoon Suk-yeol didn't meet her in person, instead they spoke by phone.

TITLE: China sanctions House Speaker Nancy Pelosi over 'egregious provocation' in visit to Taiwan
SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi was sanctioned by China on Friday, following her visit to Taiwan earlier in the week. Pelosi's immediate family members were also sanctioned.

SUMMARY: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi condemned China for trying to isolate Taiwan. She also said her visit to Taiwan does not change the “status quo” between the U.S., China and Taiwan.

TITLE: US will 'pursue' prisoner swap for Brittney Griner and Paul Whelan with Russia, Blinken says
SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the U.S. will "pursue" a prisoner swap with Russia. The comment comes one day after Brittney Griner was sentenced to nine years in prison.

TITLE: Blinken says China's military exercises near Taiwan, Japan represents 'significant escalation'
SUMMARY: Following China's recent military drills in the Taiwan Straight, Secretary of State Anthony Blinken condemned the missile launches and called them a "significant escalation."

TITLE: Thailand nightclub fire leaves at least 13 dead, dozens injured
SUMMARY: A fire broke out at the Mountain B pub in Sattahip district of Chonburi province in Thailand early Friday morning leaving at least 13 people dead.

TITLE: 3 more ships depart Ukrainian ports after Russia invasion trapped vessels with grain for months
SUMMARY: Three ships carrying tons of grain have departed Ukrainian ports for Turkey on Friday as Russia's military invasion of Ukraine continues into its 163rd day.

TITLE: US, Russia move toward Brittney Griner swap talks after Lavrov says Kremlin 'ready'
SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the U.S. will "pursue" a prisoner swap with Russia. The comment comes one day after Brittney Griner was sentenced to nine years in prison.

TITLE: Heavy rain continues to hit Japan causing flooding, evacuations and safety concerns
SUMMARY: Japan has been facing heavy rains that have caused thousands to evacuate, missing persons, flooded roads and loss of power.

TITLE: Israel kills top Islamic Jihad terrorist in Gaza, announces formal military operation
SUMMARY: The Israeli military killed a senior leader of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad terrorist group. IDF jets struck the target in Gaza on Friday.

TITLE: China halts military, climate talks with US in retaliation for Pelosi visit
SUMMARY: China has announced it will be suspending collaborative dialogues with the U.S. about key issues such as climate change and illicit drug distribution as retaliation against U.S. relations to Taiwan.

TITLE: China's Sanya Island getaway shutting down its duty free malls amid COVID outbreak
SUMMARY: China's holiday hot spot, Sanya, has started shutting down its duty-free malls in an effort to curb COVID during China's most recent outbreak.

TITLE: Blinken flies into 'superpower' battleground in Africa
SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken flies to Africa this weekend, days after his Russian counterpart swept through the continent. Both are vying for support over the war in Ukraine.

TITLE: Taliban-controlled Afghanistan intends to seek seat on UN Human Rights Council: report
SUMMARY: The UN held an "urgent debate" in July to discuss human rights concerns in Afghanistan, including the erosion of women's rights, since the Taliban took over last year.

TITLE: Ukraine-Russia War to 'enter a new phase' as armies move south to Kherson Oblast, Crimea
SUMMARY: British intelligence predicts a shift of fighting to the Kherson Oblast region will cause the Russia-Ukraine War to enter "a new phase." The war has lasted over 160 days.

TITLE: Israel, Gaza militants exchange fire, move closer to war
SUMMARY: Israel and Palestine took a series fatal strikes at one another after IDF forces targeted and killed a jihadist commander on Friday afternoon, prompting missile launches into the south.

TITLE: Taiwan says China is rehearsing invasion attack
SUMMARY: Taiwan is warning its allies that naval and aerial military drills by the People's Liberation Army near the Taiwan Strait are a rehearsal for a real invasion of the island.

TITLE: How is that Kremlin bank account looking?
SUMMARY: In the face of mounting sanctions the Russian economy isn't doing as badly as initially thought. One big reason: income from Russia's oil exports continues to come in.

TITLE: Israel, militants trade fire as Gaza death toll climbs to 24
SUMMARY: Israeli airstrikes destroyed homes in Gaza on Saturday and Palestinian rocket barrages into southern Israel continued for a second day.

TITLE: New Pompeii furnishings highlight middle-class homes before Mt. Vesuvius eruption
SUMMARY: Pompeii's archaeological park announced recent findings of four new rooms. The objects found in the rooms gave a glimpse of life before the eruption.

TITLE: Fire at Cuban oil facility leaves 1 dead, 121 injured: officials
SUMMARY: A fire at a Cuban oil storage facility killed one person, injured 121 people and left 17 firefighters missing. About 800 people were evacuated from the closest neighborhood.

TITLE: Archie Battersbee: 12-year-old boy dies hours after hospital ends life support against parents' wishes
SUMMARY: Archie Battersbee, 12, died hours after he was taken off of life support at Royal London Hospital in London. The death happened after a judge decided against his parents' wishes.

SUMMARY: Ukrainian Natalia Popova has rescued hundreds of animals during Russia's war in Ukraine, traveling throughout the country and rehabilitating them at her shelter.

TITLE: Israel kills second senior Islamic Jihad commander in the Gaza Strip amid war worries
SUMMARY: Israeli authorities announced a second senior Islamic Jihad commander in the Gaza Strip was killed in an airstrike on Saturday. Israel called the strike a "pinpoint" attack.

TITLE: Brazilian police accuse German diplomat of murdering husband in brutal beating
SUMMARY: Brazilian police claim German consul Uwe Herbert Hahn beat his husband, Walter Maximilien Biot, to death and attempted to cover up the alleged crime before police arrived.

TITLE: Israeli forces make overnight arrests in Gaza as death toll climbs to 32
SUMMARY: Palestinian authorities say 32 people have been killed in Israeli strikes this weekend, but the IDF says the deaths are due to poorly-aimed rockets from Gaza militants.

TITLE: China conducts 4th straight day of military drills around Taiwan after Pelosi visit to island: report
SUMMARY: Taiwan has indicated it will push back against China's aggressions with its own live-fire drills, including snipers, helicopters and a mix of combat and armored vehicles.

TITLE: Israeli forces make overnight arrests in West Bank as Gaza death toll climbs to 32
SUMMARY: Palestinian authorities say 32 people have been killed in Israeli strikes this weekend, but the IDF says the deaths are due to poorly-aimed rockets from Gaza militants.

TITLE: Taiwan ambassador: Beijing is 'manufacturing' the crisis, China has prepared invasion force 'for some time'
SUMMARY: Taiwan's Representative to the U.S. Hsiao Bi-khim called China's response "unprecedented," but former U.S. Ambassador to the UN Nikki Haley called it a "temper tantrum."

TITLE: At least 121 injured as firefighters battle vast blaze at Cuban oil facility
SUMMARY: Cuban firefighters were joined by special teams sent by Mexico and Venezuela on Sunday as they battled for a second day to control a fire blazing at a big oil tank farm in the western province of Matanzas.

TITLE: Palestinian Islamic Jihad’s rocket barrages on Israel trace back to 'Iran's regional tentacles,' experts say
SUMMARY: Iran’s regime has spread its tentacles, effectively instigating Palestinian Islamic Jihad missile attacks against Israel, Middle East security experts say.

TITLE: Israel, Palestinian militants agree to cease-fire in Gaza brokered by Egypt
SUMMARY: Israel and Palestinian militants have reportedly agreed to a cease-fire in the Gaza strip after a weekend of some of the worst violence in more than a year.

TITLE: Benjamin Netanyahu calls out 'Palestinian propaganda machine,' saying it has been 'caught red-handed'
SUMMARY: Former Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu discussed the latest conflict before Israel and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad militant group reportedly agreed to a cease-fire.

TITLE: Actress Jessica Chastain meets with Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Hollywood actress Jessica Chastain made a visit to Ukraine on Sunday. She met with Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv and also visited a children's hospital as Russia's war on the country rages on.

TITLE: China announces military exercises around Taiwan will be extended
SUMMARY: China said it would be extending military exercises near Taiwan that include anti-submarine drills. Taiwan’s army will respond by conducting some drills of its own.

TITLE: One year after Afghanistan, spy agencies pivot toward China
SUMMARY: Despite US efforts to counter terrorism in the Middle East, CIA deputy director David Cohen made clear the agency's focus continues to stay on Beijing.

TITLE: China to ramp up military drills around Taiwan after island hosts foreign head-of-state
SUMMARY: St. Vincent Prime Minister Ralph Gonsalves visited Taiwan on Monday, deriding China as a "bully" even as the Chinese military ramped up military drills surrounding the island.

TITLE: French woman attacked by polar bear in Norway, escapes with only minor injuries
SUMMARY: A French woman was attacked by a polar bear in Norway’s remote Arctic Svalbard Islands on Monday morning. The woman escaped with only minor injuries.

TITLE: UN trying to gain access to Ukrainian nuclear plant after 'suicidal' shelling
SUMMARY: International experts fear a "nuclear disaster" at a Ukrainian nuclear power plant after Russian and Ukrainian forces traded blame for shelling around the plant.
